item.title: NASA's IXPE Helps Unlock the Secrets of Famous Exploded Star
item.description: Astronomers have made the first measurement in X-rays of the polarization from the remains of an exploded star called Cassiopeia A.

item.title: NASA's Chandra Finds Galaxy Cluster Collision on a "WHIM"
item.description: Astronomers taking inventory of the material in the local universe keep coming up short. A new result from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory about a system of colliding galaxy clusters may help explain this shortfall.

item.title: NASA's Chandra Adds X-ray Vision to Webb Images
item.description: Images combining Webb infrared data with X-rays collected by Chandra underscore how the power of any of these telescopes is only enhanced when joined with others.

item.title: Setting the Clock on a Stellar Explosion
item.description: It is often difficult to determine the timeline of a star's demise. By studying the spectacular remains of a supernova, a team has found enough clues to help wind back the clock.

item.title: NASA Telescopes Capture Stellar Delivery Service for Black Hole
item.description: Astronomers may have witnessed a smaller galaxy colliding with a larger spiral galaxy and delivering a supermassive black hole.

item.title: Embracing a Rejected Star
item.description: Zeta Ophiuchi is a star with a complicated past, having likely been ejected from its birthplace by a powerful stellar explosion. A new look by NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory helps tell more of the story of this runaway star.

item.title: Chandra Shows Giant Black Hole Spins Slower Than Its Peers
item.description: Astronomers used NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory to determine the spin of the black hole in H1821+643, making it the most massive one to have an accurate measurement of this fundamental property.

item.title: NASA's Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-ray Speed Trap
item.description: A young pulsar is blazing through the Milky Way at a speed of over a million miles per hour. This stellar speedster is one of the fastest objects of its kind ever seen.

item.title: Colossal Collisions Linked to Solar System Science
item.description: A new study shows a deep connection between some of the largest, most energetic events in the Universe and much smaller, weaker ones powered by our own Sun.

item.title: NASA Telescopes Support Event Horizon Telescope in Studying Milky Way's Black Hole
item.description: As the Event Horizon Telescope was collecting data for its remarkable new image of the Milky Way's supermassive black hole, a legion of other telescopes, including Chandra, was also watching.
